event.title: were established in New York State in 1683

data.event: When counties were established in New York State in 1683, the present Washington County was part of Albany County.

event.title: was reduced in size on July 3, 1766

data.event: This county was reduced in size on July 3, 1766 by the creation of Cumberland County, and further on March 16, 1770 by the creation of Gloucester County, both containing territory now in Vermont.

event.title: the creation of Cumberland County, and further on March 16, 1770

data.event: This county was reduced in size on July 3, 1766 by the creation of Cumberland County, and further on March 16, 1770 by the creation of Gloucester County, both containing territory now in Vermont.

event.title: the creation of Gloucester County, both containing territory now

data.event: This county was reduced in size on July 3, 1766 by the creation of Cumberland County, and further on March 16, 1770 by the creation of Gloucester County, both containing territory now in Vermont.
On March 12, 1772, what was left of Albany County was split into three parts, one remaining under the name Albany County.
